CompositionEvent.summary: The DOM CompositionEvent represents events that occur due to the user indirectly entering text.

CompositionEventCompositionEvent.summary: The CompositionEvent() constructor creates a new object.

remarks.para: -, the interface of the objects it constructs.

CompositionEventData.summary:
The data read-only property of the
interface returns the characters generated by the input
method that raised the event; its exact nature varies depending on the type of event
that generated the CompositionEvent object.
CompositionEventData.value: A string representing the event data:

CompositionEventInitCompositionEvent.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The initCompositionEvent()
method of the interface initializes the attributes of a
CompositionEvent object instance.

blockquote.para:
The correct way of creating a is to use
the constructor .

CompositionEventLocale.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The locale read-only property of the
interface returns the locale of current input method
(for example, the keyboard layout locale if the composition is associated with an Input method editor).

blockquote.para:
Even for browsers supporting it, don't trust the value contained in this property.
Even if technically it is accessible, the way to set it up when creating a
is not guaranteed to be coherent.

CompositionEventLocale.value: A string representing the locale of current input method.
